text: (hip-hop music)
- I don't even know what year this was,
but I remember we was in Chicago.
Like Friday night, in Chicago.

Lotta snow, cold, probably
like, maybe 10, 15 degrees.

We got out, they was throwin'
like little snowballs
over the, hittin' the bus.

Little stuff like that,
that goes on in the 'Go.

Chicago was feelin' they
self, they got a young player
who thinks he's it.
(drum roll)

You know the match-up's there,
you can feel it in the air.

And, I don't know how
but, we get down early.

You know the Chicago's coming
out with a bunch of energy,
it was on us.
We're throwing the ball everywhere,

and just not really into
the game for some reason.
Rajon Rondo came down, caught the play,
and instead of just delivering it.
(funky music)
Boom, right out of bounds.

You know, so we didn't really
say nothing, we saw it.

Come down the very next play,
calls the exact same play.

Put's the same juice on it,
the same flair, the same drip,
it's like, and it goes out of bounds.

Well now everybody's upset, I
think I was the most verbal.

Come on dog, you gotta be
better man, just give it to him,

just, you know it can get
there a simple way, you know.

He said something very
aggressive back to me,
I said something aggressive back to him.
We gotta keep going, we still gettin'
our butts handed to us, right.
So time out comes.
(sports buzzer)

We think, you know we
can just show up guys,
you think you all just the mighty Celtics,
like people are gonna be,
like he was really givin' it to us.

You know I took a water and
I went to pass it to 'Do.

And he gave me the, like he was
off, like he was actin' like

he was all into the
huddle, what with Doc said.
(dramatic music)

I killed the water, I
take it right to the err,
crushed the cup over my head.
And I spit the excess in the air.
(man breathing heavily)

He went around me, got
a water, and sipped it.

And when he sipped it, it
went down the wrong way.
(man coughing)

So I kinda look over to him,
and he's motioning his back.
And I was like, nah, choke.
(man coughing)

Choke, now, watch out, watch
out, perkin' out, now choke.
(man coughing)
Nah, kill!
(man coughing)
Nah, nah, kill yourself.
Die, die!

As I'm saying this, the
huddle still goin' on,
everybody's lookin' at us.
He was really choking.

And I was, when somebody say
pass the ball, pass the ball.
And I'm just goin'.
(man coughing)
(mid-tempo beat)
And I said, "Man, put y'all hand in here."
Put my hand in there.
(balloon popping)
The funniest part about that, is that,

that was the motivation
we needed to come back.

And we blew Chicago out after
that, I remember that night.
Just because I let him choke.
(hip-hop music)
(man coughing)
